Generation II.Gold: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
Generation II.Silver: It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost.
Generation II.Crystal: It hides any shiny object it finds in a secret location. Murkrow and Meowth loot one another's stashes.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pok é mon shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.

Generation III.LeafGreen: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is believed that seeing this Pokémon at night will bring about ominous occurrences.
Generation IV.Pearl: It appears near travelers to lure them into deep forests. It is said to carry misfortune.
Generation IV.Platinum: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.

Generation VI.X: It hides any shiny object it finds in a secret location. Murkrow and Meowth loot one another's stashes.
Generation VI.Y: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pokémon shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pokémon shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.

Generation VII.Sun: They awaken at dusk and take wing in the twilight, leading to the expression, "Get home before the Murkrow fly."
Generation VII.Moon: Seen as a symbol of bad luck, it's generally disliked. Yet it gives presents—objects that sparkle or shine—to Trainers it's close to.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It has a weakness for shiny things. It's been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It searches for shiny things for its boss. Murkrow's presence is said to be unlucky, so many people detest it.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is believed that seeing this Pokémon at night will bring about ominous occurrences.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It appears near travelers to lure them into deep forests. It is said to bring misfortune.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths with this creature, I've been told one must chant “ Workrum , Workrum—bad luck, don't come” as a protective incantation.
